intro: Ledebouria pilosa, commonly known as the woolly bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asphodelaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves covered in a fine, woolly coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. Ledebouria pilosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
